values:
what a shitty week...month..semester..better part of a year.

fuck you, for trying to manipulate and use me.

37 +- 1 or 2 days until Indy.  I can't wait.

Apparently I don't have to take Physics208 this summer after all...so moving away for the summer could still be a possibility after all.  I don't think I can afford it, nor do I know what that would do for my living situation here.. but how awesome would it be to get the fuck out of North Carolina for 3 months.

Now, to write a 5 page history paper before 6pm tomorrow....
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/15359.html
...are going to chicago! hopefully in january. we shall see..if not then, maybe spring break.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/14978.html
hell yeah for a random job offer from the president of a web design firm!  i hope it works out, it would be an awesome opportunity..
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/14825.html

i've always told people running away from their problems was not a solution.  today i realized that more often than not, i am guilty of the same thing.

for once, i would like to start something and finish.  to follow through without stopping.  without running away whenever i hit a bump in the road.  or without pretending like there was no bump to begin with.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/14415.html

I have developed a sudden urge to write.  To be creative . To be original.  To be artistic.  To be productive.  The more I think about it, the more excited I get about switching majors.  I feel like it is a much needed fresh start for me after all that has happened in the past year.

My life is nothing like I had envisioned it would be at this point.  I can't say that I am dissapointed with that either.  For the very first time in my life, I am living for me.  While I have a long way to go, the important thing is I feel like I am moving in the direction of being the person I want to be.  So much has changed over the past year.  So much has changed in the past two months.  Change is something I never used to feel comfortable with...at all.  However, it's something I am learning to appreciate.

I feel like I have grown up a lot in the past year.  And again, even moreso in the past two months.  I also feel like I have alot of growing up left to do.  It is really amazing to think about how much of a life changing experience going to college is.  The direction my life is currently moving is so far off track from what I imagined I always wanted.  Thank you college.  No really, thank you.  I feel perfectly fine with that.  With the decisions I have made lately, I am excited about my future.  I no longer have it all planned out.  I have a general goal and direction as far as my education and career is concerned, but in general I do not have a "life plan" which I always had growing up.  While I do believe it is important to keep your future in mind, I have learned through experience that having a plan more often than not will lead to disappointment and will rarely be followed through as intended.  It all goes back to the fact that things change.  That's what makes life interesting..

I am thankful for the new perspective I have recently obtained on life.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/14168.html
the chai tea at cup-a-joe on hillsborough st. is the best.  it is quite delicious.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/14027.html

my parents wonder why i haven't been home in a month.  instead of a nice warm welcome, i get bitched at because decisions i'm making in MY life just aren't good enough for them.  yes i know that they want what is best for me, but what they do not understand is what THEY think is best is not necessarily what I think is best for me.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/13708.html

i love not being in class today.  i say that like i went yesterday, but it feels nice to not be in class and not know in the back of your mind the reason being is that you are skipping it.  i'm sitting in cup-a-joe right now (which has a really fucking awesome chai tea drink) doing some contract work for my old job.  my aunt emailed me this week and said she has taken over the position of director for the health sciences academy and has asked me to come back to help them out with the website again.  so hopefully i can do that and make some quick cash to maybe go to new york on new years! :)  but it's doubtful..i don't have the money saved up already and i know my parents won't give it to me..that trip idea was too spontaneous.

the more i think about it the more i like the idea of switching majors to communication media.  i plan on minoring in journalism if so.  i would really love to transfer to photography school somewhere, but that's just not possible right now.  i think that my best bet as of now is to continue school with com. media, do some internships and whatnot, and use it to get a job after college.  then i can put myself through a photography program somewhere if that's what i still want to do.  i feel that if i can just find a mentor here in raleigh to work under for the next few years as i'm in school then i would learn more than i would in a school anyway.  i would love to find someone to help out in their studio doing anything really for a few hours a week..most of what i know of photography right now i credit to my mentor from my senior project in high school.

jason and i are going to take some sunset pics tonight on this place he found off of edwards mill rd. that is really awesome.  myles suggested we do a shoot off with him and one other model at two different locations..which sounds like it could be pretty fun.  i'm also gonna do another shoot with meagan as soon as we both get some free time and same with jeffrey.  the state fair will be here tomorrow for the next week which we also plan on shooting.  brandon also wants me to take some pics of him.  so much stuff to shoot coming up, i'm exited. :)
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/13555.html

yaaay my bff is coming to see me tonight!  we are going to sushi and to reevaluate our lives.  and then i'm taking her to helios.  and at some point we are going to MAKE each other do our homework.  it is sure to be much needed fun times.

ps:  sarah this is an lj just for you since you asked hahaha. :)
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/13237.html

could my life slow down some?  what a month this has been..especially the past week.  if i don't talk to you at least once a day, you're out of the loop..  and yet i'm still confused about alot of things.


i should probably quit livejournal.  i always start these things and never want to finish..i have so many things i could write about, but don't really feel the need to do so.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/12964.html

from school. from work. from people.  i need just a day or two to myself in a city other than raleigh to walk around doing photography and figuring some things out for myself.  i am physically and mentally exhausted right now.  how does one up and decide that what they have wanted to do for their entire life, and the reason they are at the school they are at is no longer what they want to do?  i always considered myself lucky because i was never lost in that aspect..i never had to wonder what to do..it was always: i want to go to ncsu for computer science, and that was that.  for as long as i can remember.  i'm not sure what changed inside of me..it's so confusing.  and i know if i tell my parents then they're going to get all worried about me which i don't want.  i wish my mom would have followed through with the plan of coming to visit me on friday for the first time in over a year..we have quite a bit to talk about.  i think i will call the com. media advisor in a minute to find out more info about the program.  tomorrow is the undergraduate course drop deadline, and i think i will be dropping a course regardless.  i wish i could just drop the entire semester and start fresh in january.

the show was alright last night.  i would have enjoyed it much more had i known more of the songs from the bands other than copeland..and had copeland played "coffee."  i had too much on my mind to really enjoy it.  not to mention i was entirely too tired from going out every night and day since last thursday.. the venue was rather interesting but it was pretty cool.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/12759.html

i'm sitting in port city java in greenville right now, trying to write the code for my csc216 programming project that is due on tuesday.  i should be excited to work on that project considering it's a class directly related to my major -- but i'm not.  and i'm really not sure why either.  this semester has gone to shit already and i haven't had anything major due yet.  but i will get plenty of that this week.  let's see why my schedule looks like for the first half of this week:

Monday:
    Calc 3 test (which will be bad, bad news..)
    Discrete Math for CSC Homework 3 Due - shouldn't be too bad if i can find the time between studying to work on it.
    Physics webassign due - those always suck.

Tuesday:
    Java 2 - Programming project 1 due (big project, that is sure to cause lot's of stress between now and then)
    Physics prelab due
                ** but tuesday night = awesome => nip/tuck party at my place with meghan josh chris and sarah.  and that means i will have to talk jeffrey into coming too if meghan hasn't already.

Wednesday:
    Physics test
    Discrete math test
    2 tests + 3 other classes, one of which is a 2 hour physics lab at night.

Basically, that shit sucks.  I love how each professor thinks their class is most important, and all of them plan to give tests this week because it's the week before the drop deadline or something.

I have totally lost my motivation and I don't know what to do to get it back.  I'm hoping that after this week is over, next weekend will be fun and relaxing and things will start to get better.  I have no doubt that I will most likely bomb most of these assignments/exams this week, but I'm going to try to manage my time better next week after these things are out of the way.  If not, I do not know what will happen.. I really really wish I had started college at wake tech and transferred over this year or next..in the long run i think that it would have been cheaper and better for me.  I'm starting to feel like I'm wasting my parents' money on school right now  Maybe I just need some adderol or something.  I think that I worked so hard in high school for so long that it just burnt me out.  Not only that but as i have grown up some over the past year, some things that back then i saw in my future and were important to me are of less  importance.  And now I'm just rambling so I'm going to get back to work.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/12433.html
what goes up must come down...

hate school.

alot.

"Dear President Bush,

Thank you for doing so much to educate people regarding God's law. I have learned a great deal from you and try to share that knowledge with as many people as I can. When someone tries to defend the homosexual lifestyle, for example, I simply remind them that Leviticus 18:22 clearly states it to be an abomination. End of debate. I do need some advice from you, however, regarding some other elements of God's Laws and how to follow them:

1. Leviticus 25:44 states that I may possess slaves, both male and female, provided they are purchased from neighboring nations. A friend of mine claims that this applies to Mexicans, but not to Canadians. Can you clarify? Why can't I own Canadians?

2. I would like to sell my daughter into slavery, as sanctioned in Exodus 21:7. In this day and age, what do you think would be a fair price for her?

3. I know that I am allowed no contact with a woman while she is in her period of menstrual uncleanliness (Lev. 15:19-24). The problem is, how do I tell? I have tried asking, but most women take offense.

4. When I burn a bull on the altar as a sacrifice, I know it creates a pleasing odor for the Lord (Lev. 1:9). The problem is my neighbors. They claim the odor is not pleasing to them. Should I smite them?
5. I have a neighbor who insists on working on the Sabbath. Exodus 35:2 clearly states that he should be put to death. Am I morally obligated to kill him myself, or should I ask the police to do it?

6. A friend of mine feels that, even though eating shellfish is an abomination (Lev. 11:10), it is a lesser abomination than homosexuality. I don't agree. Can you settle this? Are there "degrees" of abomination?

7. Lev. 21:20 states that I may not approach the altar of God if I have a defect in my sight. I have to admit that I wear reading glasses. Does my vision have to be 20/20, or is there some wiggle-room here?

8. Most of my male friends get their hair trimmed, including the hair around their temples, even though this is expressly forbidden by Lev. 19:27. How should they die?

9. I know from Lev. 11:6-8 that touching the skin of a dead pig makes me unclean, but may I still play football if I wear gloves?

10. My uncle has a farm. He violates Lev. 19:19 by planting two different crops in the same field, as does his wife by wearing garments made of two different kinds of thread (cotton/polyester blend). He also tends to curse and blaspheme a lot. Is it really necessary that we go to all the trouble of getting the whole town together to stone them (Lev. 24:10-16)? Couldn't we just burn them to death at a private family affair, like we do with people who sleep with their in-laws (Lev. 20:14)?

I know you have studied these things extensively and thus enjoy considerable expertise in such matters, so I am confident you can help.

Thank you again for reminding us that God's word is eternal and unchanging."

my mind seems to be running all over the place lately.  i don't actually know how to put into words what that means, nor do i care to attempt to.  all i know is that i'm ready for some things to change.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/11593.html

i'm sitting at work right now, bored and in an unproductive mood.  i'm supposed to go to training at the technician at 3:30 before shooting convocation tonight at the rbc center.  i really don't feel like doing that even if it is photography..i just feel like going home and going to sleep.  class starts on wednesday and i can already tell it will be one busy effing semester.  i'm taking 15 credit hours, working about 17-20 hours at FCTL, and depending on how many assignments i take and what they need me to do, anywhere from 5-15 hours/week for technician.  i'm not too worried about classes except for physics of course which i am dreading.  i'm hoping that i'll have a new attitude towards school and everything that will be keeping me busy for the next 4 months..but i know it's going to be a lot of work.  this past weekend was interesting to say the least in so many ways.  my body sushi shoot for mark went great though and hopefully that'll lead to some more paying shoots in the future.  now i'm off to training if i don't fall asleep first...
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/11350.html

so my first real photography gig aside from meagan's shoot is this weekend.  i'm shooting a "body sushi" display at a swingers party in durham lol.  that'll be interesting.  though i won't be getting paid, it could lead to some good opportunities..the chef told me he was going to advertise for me by putting my banner up, forwarding paying assignments to me in the future, and giving my name to his friend who owns a modeling agency in wilmington..so it could open some doors for me.  we'll see how it goes
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/11254.html

i finally finished setting up and configuring the new server at work yesterday after working on it for over a week.  i definitely learned alot and i enjoyed the process of it.  it's opened to my eyes to another career option as i know will be in charge of administrating the system:  professional hacking.  i know next to nothing about real security for networks and computers.  which is odd considering i write web applications and those are among the most commonly attacked systems anyway.  but anyway, "professional ethical hackers" as they are called are just computer security experts that companies hire to keep their networks secure.  they look for vulnerabilities in the systems and instruct the company on how to fix them.  they generally get paid a lot because you have to know so much to do it. it's also a job where you would be constantly learning, as the new technology keeps evolving so rapidly.  if i still wanted to go the software engineering route, i could always work somewhere that writes security software and mix the two.  there are so many options..  anyway, those are my life plans as of now....for this week at least. :)

i am ready for this week's life to come to an end.

school is school...too much work, which is getting to be very difficult.  i'm worried about the test i have tomorrow.  but i've been trying to study tonight and finish up my homework.

i've been content at work this week but extremely busy.  the assholes in itd wouldn't help us out so i just decided to tackle the project of installing our new server and migrating the data from the old one on my own.  i got ubuntu running today with apache, mysql, and php5..so i'm excited about that.  tomorrow i need to figure out how to add a user in mysql so i can hopefully send the data over.  i think that next week after my exam i will install ubuntu on my laptop and run a dualboot.  theoretically, i should be able to resize the partition and create a new fat32 partition for ubuntu and not lose anything on my windows partition.  i hope that theory proves true..but we shall see.

now i am just exhausted after working, going to class, and studying all day.  i have 3 day until i can move into my new apartment, but staying over here has worked out better than i thought it was and i even made a new friend.

i am getting a cold.  someone explain to me how that happens when it was 100 degrees out today.  i do not feel well right now.

i debated on pasting the conversation i had tonight with meghan up here, but that would be far too long.  i do not know what got into us.  but the flow of topics went something like this:  sexuality > religion > world politics > biggie and tupac?  wtf.  hahaha

but, the lyrics to this song are a bit more relevant.  not to mention musically it is pretty awesome.
"Answering Prayers"
By:  Dropping Daylight
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Picture a fire
Built by desire
Hoping the world is not alone
And it burns all night
But it's never inside
Just like a ghost among the trees
And we're living our lives
Falling through time
Try to find reason for all the life

Did they tell you believe
Did you ask about means
Did they tell to keep your eyes to the sky
Well we're hurting down here
And we're living in fear
So help me to see the reasons why

Chorus:
Is anybody there
Answering our prayers
Or did we do this to ourselves?
Would anybody dare
To question the air
Searching for answers in the clouds?

We need something to touch
Is that asking too much?
Something that we can understand
Are we chasing a ghost
An unearthly shadow
Simply a product of our own hands?

Chorus
In the clouds
In the clouds
In the clouds

Chorus

We're hurting down here
And we're living in fear
So help me see the reasons...

this is the first weekend since i moved into my apartment this summer that i've had to myself.  no trips, no visitors, no plans here.  and no money to do it with anyway... i wanted to go to norfolk tomorrow and spend the day doing photography, but since i spent so much money travelling last weekend i can't afford to do that.  the next two weekends will be full of moving, so hopefully by mid-august i'll make my way up there.  i'd like to start making some photography trips.  i really need to find a mentor that i can shoot with..i feel i'm in a creative rut.  i haven't been thoroughly pleased with any of my images lately.  perhaps i'll work on that tomorrow and maybe try to start some sort of photo story.

things have been good with my parents lately because i've been doing well in summer school and that's all they really care about.  but i'm annoyed with them.  i've been here 3 weeks shy of a year and they have yet to make a trip to Raleigh to see me other than maybe two times that they stopped by because they were already coming here for some other reason.  Even those times don't add up to maybe 3 hours that they were with me while here.  i'm not sure what the hell my mom has been telling the rest of the family but it's obviously coming off to them as i have problems and am really struggling with school or something.  i appreciate the concern but i don't need them worrying about it because i've already gotten everything straightened out.  i think that come august 5 when i'm moved into my new place i will tell them i am not going back to greenville until they come visit me unless they want to start giving me gas money to drive back all the time.

also, i came across an awesome band yesterday, Dropping Daylight.

i think i will go read some..
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/8749.html

someone send me to the brooks institute of photography in santa barbara, ca.  please.  i want to go there for visual journalism.

one day, i sense a great separation from many people/things.  not by choice, but by necessity.  i realized that by watching a movie.  funny how things impact you.

also, why did you call me last night?  quit fucking with my head.  thankfully it did not work last night becuase i know better now.  things have changed anwyay..

-----------------------------------------------


that was a saved draft that apparently i was writing a few weeks ago and never finished.  i haven't written here in a while.. i haven't felt the need or want to for some reason...and there's been a lack of stuff to write about anyway. nothing new.  nothign interesting.  same old shit every day.  got my photoblog up and running though, it's listed on coolphotoblogs.com.  i stil want to write some modifications for it and customize it some.  it's called shutterlyexposed.  (http://www.shutterlyexposed.net)  i would like to buy an old canon or nikon 35mm slr to carry around with me on a daily basis to get in the habbit of taking pictures more regularly rather than shooting hundreds of pictures in shoots like i have been doing so far.  my d50 is too bulky to carry around in its case with everything.

i want to start travelling more.  meghan and i are going to the mountains and tennessee for fall break.  talk about some awesome photography.  lq and i are planning a day trip to norfolk sometime soon to work on photography.  i would really like to go to nyc sometime over christmas break..possibly new years?  i think it would be cheaper to go there than california..plus i'd like to save california visit for next summer.


the moon was pretty awesome the other night..by time time i got to my camera and scouted a good angle downtown to shoot from it had risen which made it look smaller and you could see less detail in it.  the long-exposure washed out any remaining detail anyway..  i dont so much like the composition of this shot.  and the bb&t building is out of focus.  but aside from all of that, i still find the result interesting:
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/8462.html

copeland has become one of my favorite bands recently.  i have been listening to both of their albums nonstop.  the song "coffee" makes me think of so many things....memories of last summer, big cities, scenes from various movies, inspiration, my dream to become a photographer/photojournalist, simple things in life, coffee shops, nightlife, life in general, the future and much more.  such a wonderful song lyrically and musically.

they will be performing at the greene st. club in greensboro on august 16.  i intend on attending.  hopefully with a camera.

i wish that i was not so lazy.  and that for once i would follow through with an idea.  i have yet to create a website for my online photography portfolio, which i was waiting for summer to do.  i also have not started the online raleigh photography community that i had planned--which sucks becuase i think it is a great idea.  i'm staying in raleigh this weekend.  no visitors.  no trips.  no money to do anything with.  perhaps i'll convert everything i've been thinking and feeling lately into creativity, and be productive.  i have plenty to work on.  and i want to shoot some this weekend also.  i haven't had a weekend to myself in so long..maybe not since before the semester has been over?
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/8167.html
i want to quit life and become a famous professional photographer.
http://abitteroblivion.livejournal.com/7932.html

things have started looking up today.  minus the tropical storm, flooding, and chemistry exam i had this morning.  but that's beside the point.  i'm starting to feel better about things, especially now that i've had a chance to talk personally with each of my friends.  and i must reiterate for the ten billionth time that i truely believe i have the best friends in the world.  the most supportive, understanding, and caring friends in the world.  it's amazing how we all take care of each other like family.  most of us arecloser to each other than our real families in fact.  i know i sure as hell am.  but regardless, i have a feeling at some point i will freak out and wish things hadn't changed.

i can't belive i'm saying this but i'm really ready for friday to get here so i can go to greenville.  simply because i'm ready to just spend time with my friends.  i haven't seen tanner or christie in almost a month.  and, right now i just need to spend time with them.  and it's sarah's birthday lunch on saturday.  saturday afternoon is going to kick ass.  tanner, lq, and i are all going to drive to bethel to do some rural setting photography of old broken down houses and tobacco barns.  i have not been there in months, so that'll be weird for me.  i'm going to bring my dad's canon 35mm slr with me to shoot along with digital since i'm considering purchasing a film slr later on this summer.  i also want a holga, but i do not have one of those to play with right now.  then on sunday we are hopefully going to develop the pictures in lq's mom's darkroom at her office.  i'm pretty excited.  i need this escape right now.  and i can't think of what better people to spend it with.  [except meghan won't be there :( ]

enough of my rambling...

i am so physically, mentally, and emotionally drained right now.  i feel like exploding.  i've learned a hard life lesson, and that is in a lifetime the odds you will find people that you can trust 100% without a doubt are VERY small.  i've learned that i had an entire friendship based on lies and manipulation.  i've never felt so betrayed in my life considering i always stuck up for the person, was always there for them, went out on a limb by investing my trust in them because i thought it would help them with their problems...only to find out that everything i had ever been told since i have known this person has been a lie.  the thought that someone could even stand themselves after being so deceiving and manipulative blows my mind becuase it is something i could never do if i even wanted to try.  at the moment i feel like i have been a game that has been played for the pure fucking fun of it and that is not a pleasant feeling.. from other things i've learned not related to this person either, i am once again reminded who the very small handful of people i have that are worthy of my trust when it comes down to it.  sucks to say it, but that's life.  i now see why i have always had a problem letting people get close to me...it just turns out that very few are even worth the time of day.

for the past couple of weeks i have been pretty unmotivated while at work.  i have done just about anything else possible to keep myself busy except work to be honest.  i'm not really sure why that is because i really do like my job.  i need a new project here that i can get excited about working on so i can start being productive.  there are some projects i need to do right now that i really don't want to do, but i guess i should get started on.

on a side note, i found a cool "alternative" news website, http://www.rawstory.com/.  it is a news site that is a collection of articles and editorials from various other online news sites, but not those from the bias of mainstream media.  some of the editorials i have read up there are pretty eye-opening and brought up points on current politicial issues that i myself would not have thought of.  it also has a forum to discuss those issues with other readers.

last night was awesome.  meghan and i took pictures in the boylan heights neighborhood downtown and found a lot of cool scenery.  we then drove around downtown forever in the pouring rain trying to find somewhere to eat...finally, we decided to check out el rodeo, a mexican restaurant in city market.  artspace is right beside el rodeo and last night was "first friday"..so of course, we had to check it out.  artspace is a HUGE building full of studios for local artists.  there was stuff on display everywhere and all of the artists were there.  not to mention free food and wine!  we ventured around the entire place, stepping in almost every studio we saw.  there was quite a bit of people there.  we went in little old one man's studio upstairs back in the corner because he had some very interesting looking paintings.  after browsing all of his work, we started talking to him and ended up staying in his studio for half an hour just talking about all of the paintings.  it was fascinating to hear the stories behind some of his work which was incredible.  he had a very unique style.  i very much enjoyed that and intend on going to more "first friday" events in the future.  afterwards we walked around city market some more.  there was a band playing out on the cobblestone streets that we watched for a bit and i took some pictures.  finally, we ended up going to the top of a parking deck, about 7 or 8 stories, and sitting on the ledge where from that one angle, Raleigh looks like a big city.  we stayed up there for probably an hour and a half just talking about anything and everything everything and it was so peaceful.  We laughed at people walking by way below us.  we laughed especially hard at the cop we saw on the weirdest scooter-type thing i've ever seen as he speed off to fight crime in probably the least intimidating thing i have ever seen that only went maybe 10 mph. i wish i had someone here in Raleigh that i could spend nights like this with.  i don't know anyone besides the bffs who wouldn't have been bored out of their minds in anything we did last night, and yet we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

it's nice to talk to someone that you haven't had a real conversation with in such a long time, and still feel as close as ever to them.  ashton called me tonight and we talked for over an hour about any and everything.  for a long time, she was the only friend i had and she stood by me through a really difficult time and even lost her best friend (my exgirlfriend) because she stood up for me.  we were really close for a long time, but around christmas break of last year we both had new groups of friends and a lot things going on and started going in different directions.  by the time it was summer, we rarely talked at all.  since i started college, we've maybe talked 5 or 10 times.  but when i talked to her tonight it was like nothing ever changed, and she still means as much to me as she ever did before.  she is one of the first true friends that i have had...and something like that never fades, even when life gets in the way.  i miss our talks and jokes and fun..i have many memories with her that i will never forget.  looking back on them really makes me smile.

this time of year -- and life -- brings with it a lot of transition in many ways.  i am in the process of transitioning to greenville for a week and a half or so, and then moving into my summer apartment in raleigh.  less than week after that i will start summer session and full-time work.  i have just finished the second semester of my freshman year [which has turned out to be a nightmare].  in only 3 months i will be moving again, to another apartment in raleigh.

being in college, i have discovered you go through other types of transitions as well.  being exposed to many new ideas, experiences, lifestyles, people, and environments all lead to mental transitions.  it is how you handle all of the different kinds of transitions that defines your future and the person you will become.  kind of scary to think about if sit back and look at the bigger picture of things.

although i've only been in college for one year i've already changed my outlook on a lot of things.  i'm sure in the next 3-4 years that process will continue to occur as i am faced with even more new things.  some things are easier to adjust to than other.  to say the least, i can say that i have a lot of work to do on various levels to become well-adjusted.

after looking over this post, i realize it is not the easiest to understand...but as meghan said, "i have all these ideas and don't know how to put them into words."



on a side note, i have many things i would like to accomplish this summer.  therefore i see it as a benefit to myself to start compiling a list.  so here's a few things for starters:

- retake CH101 successfully
- possibly retake MA241..successfully.  [although i pray that is not necessary]
- make new friends in raleigh
- train and shoot for the Technician
- start designing and developing an online photography portfolio for myself in freetime at the Technician
- work with Tanner on our raleigh photography community website
- work with Tanner on reorganizing our business and completing the website

as i was eating breakfast before my psychology exam this morning, it hit me.  i have decided to stay in raleigh this summer and for the most part i made that decision on my own (aside from me having to retake a class for summer school).  but as i was saying, it just hit me today that this summer would be nothing like the previous one at all..nor will it ever be that way again..and that saddens me to think about.  i saw my best friends literally almost every day last summer that i possibly could unless i or they were out of town.  i realized today that tanner won't be a phonecall away from hanging out, lq won't be a call away from going to lunch together on our lunchbreaks from work or going to get coffee every night or best buy or b&n etc.. christie wont be call away from all of the above, meghan wont' be there to go out and pick on people hahah, jeffrey won't be there to party (well he will be there technically but i'm sure i'll never see him), etc... even though i have been in raleigh all year with intentions of trying to stay here for the summer, it still saddens me.  and at the same time, i don't plan on going home every weekend and such either, unless people start visiting me..including my parents.  i'm really excited about the summer and my new roommates as they seem to be awesome and i'm sure we will have a lot of fun, but nothing will compare to last summer or those people who i miss dearly.  :-/
